headline: Easy Baking Powder Drop Biscuits
description: This easy drop biscuit recipe is made with a handful of pantry and fridge staples. Whip up a batch while you make your favorite sausage gravy!
name: Easy Baking Powder Drop Biscuits

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.

Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Cut in cold butter with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk, a little at a time, until dough is moistened. Drop dough by heaping spoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 12 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I doubled the recipe, but still followed it mostly. I used margarine instead of butter. I live at a high altitude so I added a teaspoon more of baking powder. I also didn't use quite as much milk as allowed in the recipe but stopped when it got good and sticky. The biscuits rose beautifully and were nice and soft on the inside and held together well.

Absolutely delicious...I tweaked it a tiny bit & stirred in a dash of grated Parmesan cheese & garlic powder to the dry ingredients & about a half-handful of shredded Colby Jack at the end. I used a really big serving spoon & placed a spoonful on the parchment paper-lined sheet & baked according to the recipe. Eight biscuits later, they were perfectly done, steamy hot & oh-so moist...I ate 2 for dinner, wrapped the rest in foil & ate them throughout the following day.
